p: The count of total aerobic mesophilic bacteria was significantly lower ( P < 0.0001; CV = 9.54%; Figure 3) after spraying with clove essential oil (2.30 ± 0.24 log 10 CFU/mL) than on nonsanitized eggs (3.49 ± 0.34 log 10 CFU/mL) or on eggs sprayed with grain alcohol (3.09 ± 0.14 log 10 CFU/mL) but did not differ significantly from the count in the paraformaldehyde group (2.23 ± 0.29 log 10 CFU/mL).
